intro: Callipteris ridleyi, commonly known as the Ridleys' pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Callipteris ridleyi is often found in coastal and lowland areas, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
